intro: Raddiella esenbeckii, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh environments. Raddiella esenbeckii is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient conditions.
